passage_text: 1 The cost of living in Galveston is 0.5 % greater than the Texas average. 2  The cost of living in Galveston is 9.8 % less than the national average. 3  Each cost of living index is based on a national average of 100.

COST OF LIVING OVERVIEW. Our cost of living indices are based on a US average of 100. An amount below 100 means Galveston, Texas is cheaper than the US average. A cost of living index above 100 means Galveston, Texas is more expensive. Overall, Galveston, Texas cost of living is 98.20.

The cost of living in Texas (TX) is lower than the nationwide average. The average yearly pay in Texas is $51,201.00, which is higher than the U.S. average annual salary by $1,393.00. The consumer price index (CPI) of 223 in Texas is 4.29% lower than the U.S. city average CPI of 233.

The cost of living in Galveston, Texas (TX) is lower than the average cost of living in the state of Texas and lower than the nationwide city average. The average annual pay in Galveston is $43,830.00, which is $7,371.00 lower than the salary average in Texas and lower than the U.S. average yearly wages by $5,978.00.
